channel.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a television station and all the programmes that it broadcasts
channel.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The kids are watching cartoons on the Disney Channel.
He changed channels to watch the basketball game.
channel.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a system or method that you use to send or obtain information, goods, permission etc
channel.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The U.S. is working through diplomatic channels to find a solution.
The new software will be sold through existing distribution channels.
It is important that we open channels of communication with the police.
channel.translation[0].definitions[2].de: an area of water that connects two larger areas of water
channel.translation[0].definitions[3].de: the area of water between France and England
channel.translation[0].definitions[4].de: the deepest part of a river, harbour, or sea, especially where it is deep enough to allow ships to sail in
channel.translation[0].definitions[5].de: a passage that water or other liquids flow along
channel.translation[0].definitions[6].de: a particular range of sound waves which can be used to send and receive radio messages
channel.translation[0].definitions[7].de: a long deep line cut into a surface or a long deep space between two edges
channel.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: The sliding doors fit into these plastic channels.
channel.translation[0].definitions[8].de: a way of expressing your thoughts, feelings, or physical energy
channel.translation[0].definitions[8].ex: Art provides a channel for the children’s creativity.
channel.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: NTV is Russia’s leading television channel.
What’s on the movie channel tonight?
ABC announced its plans for a new cable channel.
Channel 5 is the newest terrestrial channel in the UK.
You can’t record one digital channel while watching another.
On commercial channels they have advertisement breaks.
Use the remote control to change channels.
In 1994, SKY launched two new channels.
The kids are always watching the cartoon channel.
All the channels are broadcasting the match live.
I usually start channel-hopping when the adverts are on.
channel.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to control and direct something such as money or energy towards a particular purpose
channel.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Most of his energy was channeled into writing and lecturing.
Profits are channelled to conservation groups.
The famine relief money was channelled through the UN.
channel.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to control or direct people or things to a particular place, work, situation etc
channel.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: Women were likely to be channeled into jobs as teachers or nurses.
Drugs from government pharmacies were being channeled into illegal drug markets.
channel.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to cut a long deep line in something
channel.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: Water had channelled grooves in the rock.
channel.translation[1].definitions[3].de: to send water through a passage
channel.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: An efficient irrigation system channels water to the crops.
channel.translation[1].definitions[4].de: to allow a spirit to come into your body and speak through you, or to tell people a message that you have received in this way
channel.translation[1].definitions[4].ex: She claims to channel the spirit of a 2,000-year-old hunter.
channel.translation[1].definitions[5].de: to look or sound like a famous person, especially someone who is dead
channel.translation[1].definitions[5].ex: In her latest video, Kylie is channelling Marilyn Monroe.
channel.translation[3].definitions[0].de: a system that is used for supplying information or goods
channel.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: A direct marketing channel moves goods directly from manufacturer to consumer.
channel.translation[3].definitions[1].de: a television station and all the programmes broadcast on it
channel.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: a 24-hour channel devoted exclusively to football
channel.translation[3].definitions[2].de: a route along which computer signals can be sent, for example a CABLE
channel.translation[4].definitions[0].de: to control and direct something such as money or effort towards a particular purpose
channel.translation[4].definitions[0].ex: The company wanted to channel all its financial resources into completing several major office buildings.
The International Finance Corp. will channel funds through Zivnobanka for other investment projects in the Czech republic.
